thread.title: Dashcam captures moment of fatal Melbourne plane crash (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Dashcam captures moment of fatal Melbourne plane crash (VIDEO)

author: RT
title: Dashcam captures moment of fatal Melbourne plane crash (VIDEO)
text:
Dashcam captures moment of fatal Melbourne plane crash (VIDEO) Published time: 21 Feb, 2017 22:57 Get short URL © Team2j / YouTube The moment a charter plane plummeted into a shopping mall in Melbourne was captured by a dashboard camera from a car approaching the crash site. 
The plane can be seen descending onto the Direct Factory Outlet shopping mall. 
All five people onboard died in the crash, described as “ the worst civil aviation accident that our state has seen for 30 years ” by Victoria Prime Minister Daniel Andrews. 
Another dashcam video shows the crashed plane erupting into a huge ball of flames. 
READ MORE: 5 killed as plane smashes into Melbourne shopping mall – Victoria police (VIDEO) 
The Beechcraft B200 King Air aircraft took off from Essendon airport, a small airfield mainly used by light planes, at around 8:30am for King Island. 
Veteran pilot Max Quatermain was carrying four American passengers who were headed to the island in Tasmania on a golfing trip. Quatermain sent two Mayday calls shortly before crashing, citing “ catastrophic engine failure. ” Driving by a possible plane crash at #Essendon Airport and DFO pic.twitter.com/JpSCKbgxHN
